main event: A radar observation of an unidentified flying object was recorded in Marlin, Texas on 3 July 1950.
interesting points: The radar scope showed one target for 2 1/2 minutes before it went off the scope., No visual observation of the object was made., An old Project Blue Book document was referenced., The object was described as wind-borne and not of military interest., Weather conditions were clear with no clouds and a surface wind of 15 knots.
sighted object: one round object emitting a brilliant white light
witness description: Mr & Mrs Marlin, both age 53, appeared reliable and coherent during the telephone conversation
